title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
Note: Students need not make specific reference to the Declaration of Independence.

13-15: Demonstrates a knowledge of the complexity and historical development of the colonial political system, the British political system (King and Parliament), and the structure of the empire; has a well-substantiated thesis; discusses the question of colonial perceptions of tyranny.

10-12: Shows a clear understanding of colonial and parliamentary government; recognizes relationships in the British empire; clear thesis with strong supportive evidence; is aware of colonial perceptions of tyranny.

7-9: Shows some understanding of colonial AND parliamentary government; relevant information within a clear context; addresses the question of colonial reactions to British policies.

4-6: Shows superficial sense of colonial OR parliamentary government; mentions some relevant information with no clear context; addresses question by listing British actions, with little or no understanding of the imperial system.

1-3: Shows no clear sense of colonial or parliamentary government; irrelevant information; does not address the question; no recognition of the relationship between the British political system and the colonies within the empire.
